HTML & CSS Exams Schedule - Semester 1, Academic Year 2023-2024

Group Exam Type Date and Time Room
222, 223, 226 Main 27.01.2024, 9:00 L308, L339, L343
225 Main 29.01.2024, 17:00 L308, L339
221, 224, 227 Main 09.02.2024, 11:00 L308, L336, L307, L320
All Groups Retake 21.02.2024, 14:00 L336, L339, L343

Notes

  • If you need to present on a secondary date, please use one of the exam dates for the other groups;
  • The exam for group 225 could not be scheduled in Academic Info;
  • Students from the Mathematical Informatics specialization are requested to attend the exam with the group they attended the lab with.

At the Beginning of the Semester

  • Please join the team with the code 'kflnhge';
  • Strictly adhere to the division into subgroups;
  • Students from other specializations (Mathematics in Romanian), other faculties, and retake students will be accepted a maximum of 2 times in a laboratory. These students are requested to choose the laboratory subgroup they will attend (the same throughout the semester) in the first 2 weeks of the teaching activities;
  • Students from the specializations Mathematics in English or Computer Science in English are kindly asked to attend the course and laboratories coordinated by Assoc. Prof. Dr. John Doe (Computer Networks, MLE5002).

Requirements and Evaluation Method

  • Attendance at laboratories is mandatory, with a minimum of 90% attendance (at least 12 out of 14 laboratories). Failure to meet these minimum thresholds (due to unexcused absences) results in the student not being accepted for exams (both in the normal session and the retake session).
  • Minimum grade for laboratory activity: 5
  • The minimum grade for the session exam (online multiple-choice exam on Moodle): 5
  • In the final grade, the laboratory will have a weight of 40%, and the session exam will have a weight of 60%.

Course Objectives

  • Grasp the foundational principles of HTML and CSS
  • Develop proficiency in creating responsive and accessible web designs
  • Explore advanced HTML and CSS techniques
  • Gain practical experience in building web pages with HTML and CSS
  • Apply HTML and CSS in the context of web development workflows
  • Implement effective styling and layout techniques
  • Learn debugging and testing strategies for HTML and CSS
  • Explore modern web design tools and frameworks
  • Collaborate on a comprehensive web development project

Course content

Module Topic
1 Introduction to Web Development
2 HTML Fundamentals
3 CSS Fundamentals
4 Page Layout with CSS
5 Responsive Web Design
6 CSS Transitions and Animations
7 HTML5 and CSS3 Features
8 Best Practices and Optimization
9 Version Control and Collaboration
10 Final Project
